results.title: 2023 Oscar Nominations: Snubs and Surprises
results.abstract: It’s a record-setting year for performers of Asian descent. In the actress race, there’s room for Andrea Riseborough but not Viola Davis or Danielle Deadwyler.

results.title: Angela Bassett Nearly Missed the Announcement of Her Own Nomination
results.abstract: The sleepless actress had trouble with the television, but tuned in just as her category was being unveiled. “I’m glad I showed up on time,” she said.

multimedia.caption: Angela Bassett earned her second Oscar nomination on Tuesday, this time for “Black Panther: Wakanda Forever.”

results.title: Andrea Riseborough Can’t Believe She Was Nominated for an Oscar, Either
results.abstract: A social media campaign by some famous friends netted the star of “To Leslie,” a little-known microbudget indie, her first Oscar nomination.

multimedia.caption: Andrea Riseborough in “To Leslie.” She said of her Oscar nomination, “There’s a large part of me that’s really unable to accept that it’s happened.”

results.title: ‘Room’ Will Be Staged on Broadway, Starring Adrienne Warren
results.abstract: Emma Donoghue adapted the show from her best-selling 2010 novel; she also wrote the screenplay for the 2015 film.

multimedia.caption: Adrienne Warren won a Tony Award in 2021 for portraying Tina Turner in the musical “Tina.”
Adrienne Warren won a Tony Award in 2021 for portraying Tina Turner in the musical “Tina.”

results.title: Edward Pressman, Film Producer Who Bet on Unsung Talent, Dies at 79
results.abstract: He took on Oliver Stone, Terrence Malick, Kathryn Bigelow and other directors just starting out. His name was on “Hoffa,” “American Psycho,” “Conan the Barbarian” and many more films.

multimedia.caption: Edward R. Pressman at his office in Beverly Hills, Calif., in 2001. He was producer or executive producer on almost 100 movies across a range of genres.
Edward R. Pressman at his office in Beverly Hills, Calif., in 2001. He was producer or executive producer on almost 100 movies across a range of genres.
Edward R. Pressman at his office in Beverly Hills, Calif., in 2001. He was producer or executive producer on almost 100 movies across a range of genres.

results.title: ‘The Wandering Earth II’ Review: It Wanders Too Far
results.abstract: The audacious sequel to Frant Gwo’s 2019 sci-fi blockbuster follows survivors working to avert planetary disaster, but it loses much of the glee of its predecessor.

multimedia.caption: From left, Wu Jing, Wang Zhi and Kawawa Kadichi in a scene from the sci-fi sequel “The Wandering Earth II.”
From left, Wu Jing, Wang Zhi and Kawawa Kadichi in a scene from the sci-fi sequel “The Wandering Earth II.”

results.title: In ‘M3gan,’ a Detective’s Guilty Laugh Speaks Volumes About Him (and Us)
results.abstract: What’s so funny about his inappropriate response to a boy’s injury? The director pushed to keep the bizarre moment in the film, for good reason.

multimedia.caption: A character’s awkward chuckle got the biggest laugh at a test screening of “M3gan,” the director said.
A character’s awkward chuckle got the biggest laugh at a test screening of “M3gan,” the director said.

results.title: Winning a BAFTA? Just One of Joanna Scanlan’s Career Surprises.
results.abstract: Last year, the British actress won for “After Love,” a melodrama she led after years of comedic roles and only getting her first acting job at 34.

multimedia.caption: Joanna Scanlan won a BAFTA for her performance in “After Love,” in which she plays a Muslim convert who discovers her late husband had concealed a secret life.
Joanna Scanlan won a BAFTA for her performance in “After Love,” in which she plays a Muslim convert who discovers her late husband had concealed a secret life.

results.title: Page and Screen: Can You Guess This Author With a Flair for Thrillers?
results.abstract: This writer’s work kept readers — and moviegoers — on edge for decades. Who is it?

results.title: Julian Sands Is Reported Missing on Mountain Hike in California
results.abstract: The search for Mr. Sands, a British actor known for the 1986 film “A Room With a View” and other roles, is an avid trail hiker. His disappearance follows weeks of devastating weather across California.
results.byline: By Derrick Bryson Taylor and Johnny Diaz

results.abstract: In Matt Carter’s gay rugby film, sports and romance smash together like two players from opposing teams.

results.title: ‘New Gods: Yang Jian’ Review: ‘Cowboy Bebop’ Without the Bop
results.abstract: In this animated fantasy, a former deity must confront his traumatic past if he hopes to find absolution and save the world.

results.title: ‘The Last Autumn’ Review: The Majesty of Shepherds
results.abstract: This observational documentary about an aging farming couple on the Icelandic coast unfolds like an elegy to a life lived off the land.

multimedia.caption: “The Last Autumn,” from the director Yrsa Roca Fannberg, follows a couple on the Icelandic coast as they prepare for the annual autumnal ritual of herding their sheep down the mountain.
“The Last Autumn,” from the director Yrsa Roca Fannberg, follows a couple on the Icelandic coast as they prepare for the annual autumnal ritual of herding their sheep down the mountain.

results.title: ‘When You Finish Saving the World’ Review: Mother and Son Disunion
results.abstract: Julianne Moore plays a parent to a son (Finn Wolfhard) with whom she fails to see eye-to-eye in this comedy directed by Jesse Eisenberg.

results.title: Alec Baldwin Will Be Charged With Involuntary Manslaughter in ‘Rust’ Killing
results.abstract: A gun that Mr. Baldwin was rehearsing with went off, killing the film’s cinematographer. The armorer responsible for weapons on set also faces manslaughter charges.
results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Graham Bowley

results.title: ‘All Eyes Off Me’ Review: Scenes of Seduction
results.abstract: A series of sexual and social situations unspool in this portrait of Israeli youth culture.
